messages.title: A record of action, A promise of more.
messages.content: Nigel says: Walsall North needs improvements in skills, jobs and health. These require the social disparities between areas to be tackled and proper devolution of powers and resources to local government to improve infrastructure, while growing the economy.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Cut the deficit by half, reducing borrowing by £33,000 for every household in Britain. Increase job opportunities and balance the books as fairly as possible.
Given an £800 tax cut to low and middle income workers. Cut Income Tax by a further £400 for ordinary workers.
Increased the NHS budget each year, with £6,000 more doctors than under Labour. Raise NHS spending by £8 billion a year. Guarantee mental health equality.
Provided an extra £2.5bn a year for struggling school kids. Protect education spending from cradle to college.

issues.economy: Cut the deficit by half, reducing borrowing by £33,000 for every household in Britain. Balance the books as fairly as possible.
issues.education: Provided an extra £2.5bn a year for struggling school kids. Protect education spending from cradle to college.

leaflet.personalStatement: Nigel says: Walsall North needs improvements in skills, jobs and health. These require the social disparities between areas to be tackled and proper devolution of powers and resources to local government to improve infrastructure, while growing the economy.

images.caption: Liberal Democrat for Walsall North - Nigel Jones in front of a city background.
